definition: A German word often used to express a sense of generalization or emphasis, typically used in questions, negative statements, or to convey a strong opinion. It can also be employed to indicate surprise or disbelief.

examples.english: I don't feel like it at all.

examples.german: Das ist überhaupt nicht mein Problem.
examples.english: That's not my problem at all.
I don't understand that at all.
That was not planned at all.
I have no idea at all.
